commit_message:
Cleanup: remove unused code from store_utils

store_utils.py contains several methods not used anywhere in the
codebase.
This patch removes the unused code.

Change-Id: I8faa87e1dcce053b19a37c19856eb53529e0ec78
Closes-Bug: #1262051
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/glance refs/changes/62/63562/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: import ConfigParser import httplib import os import random import swiftclientfrom glance.store.s3 import get_s3_location, get_calling_format def _uniq(value): return '%s.%d' % (value, random.randint(0, 99999)) def setup_swift(test): # Test machines can set the GLANCE_TEST_SWIFT_CONF variable # to override the location of the config file for migration testing CONFIG_FILE_PATH = os.environ.get('GLANCE_TEST_SWIFT_CONF') if not CONFIG_FILE_PATH: test.disabled_message = "GLANCE_TEST_SWIFT_CONF environ not set." print("GLANCE_TEST_SWIFT_CONF environ not set.") test.disabled = True return if os.path.exists(CONFIG_FILE_PATH): cp = ConfigParser.RawConfigParser() try: cp.read(CONFIG_FILE_PATH) defaults = cp.defaults() for key, value in defaults.items(): if key == 'swift_store_container': test.__dict__[key] = (_uniq(value)) else: test.__dict__[key] = value except ConfigParser.ParsingError as e: test.disabled_message = ("Failed to read test_swift.conf " "file. Got error: %s" % e) test.disabled = True return try: swift_host = test.swift_store_auth_address if not swift_host.startswith('http'): swift_host = 'https://' + swift_host user = test.swift_store_user key = test.swift_store_key container_name = test.swift_store_container except AttributeError as e: test.disabled_message = ("Failed to find required configuration " "options for Swift store. " "Got error: %s" % e) test.disabled = True return swift_conn = swiftclient.Connection( authurl=swift_host, auth_version=test.swift_store_auth_version, user=user, key=key, snet=False, retries=1) try: _resp_headers, containers = swift_conn.get_account() except Exception as e: test.disabled_message = ("Failed to get_account from Swift " "Got error: %s" % e) test.disabled = True return try: for container in containers: if container == container_name: swift_conn.delete_container(container) except swiftclient.ClientException as e: test.disabled_message = ("Failed to delete container from Swift " "Got error: %s" % e) test.disabled = True return test.swift_conn = swift_conn try: swift_conn.put_container(container_name) except swiftclient.ClientException as e: test.disabled_message = ("Failed to create container. " "Got error: %s" % e) test.disabled = True return def teardown_swift(test): swift_conn = test.swift_conn container_name = test.swift_store_container if not test.disabled: try: _resp_headers, containers = swift_conn.get_account() # Delete all containers matching the container name prefix for container in containers: if container == container_name: swift_conn.delete_container(container) except swiftclient.ClientException as e: if e.http_status == httplib.CONFLICT: pass else: raise test.swift_conn.put_container(test.swift_store_container) def get_swift_uri(test, image_id): # Apparently we must use HTTPS with Cloud Files now, otherwise # we will get a 301 Moved.... :( user = swiftclient.quote('%(swift_store_user)s' % test.__dict__) creds = (user + ':%(swift_store_key)s' % test.__dict__) uri = 'swift+https://' + creds uri += ('@%(swift_store_auth_address)s/%(swift_store_container)s/' % test.__dict__) uri += image_id uri = uri.replace('@http://', '@') uri = uri.replace('@https://', '@') return uri def setup_s3(test): # Test machines can set the GLANCE_TEST_S3_CONF variable # to override the location of the config file for S3 testing CONFIG_FILE_PATH = os.environ.get('GLANCE_TEST_S3_CONF') if not CONFIG_FILE_PATH: test.disabled_message = "GLANCE_TEST_S3_CONF environ not set." test.disabled = True return if os.path.exists(CONFIG_FILE_PATH): cp = ConfigParser.RawConfigParser() try: cp.read(CONFIG_FILE_PATH) defaults = cp.defaults() for key, value in defaults.items(): test.__dict__[key] = (_uniq(value) if key == 's3_store_bucket' else value) except ConfigParser.ParsingError as e: test.disabled_message = ("Failed to read test_s3.conf config " "file. Got error: %s" % e) test.disabled = True return from boto.s3.connection import S3Connection from boto.exception import S3ResponseError try: s3_host = test.s3_store_host access_key = test.s3_store_access_key secret_key = test.s3_store_secret_key bucket_name = test.s3_store_bucket except AttributeError as e: test.disabled_message = ("Failed to find required configuration " "options for S3 store. Got error: %s" % e) test.disabled = True return calling_format = get_calling_format(test.s3_store_bucket_url_format) s3_conn = S3Connection(access_key, secret_key, host=s3_host, is_secure=False, calling_format=calling_format) test.bucket = None try: buckets = s3_conn.get_all_buckets() for bucket in buckets: if bucket.name == bucket_name: test.bucket = bucket except S3ResponseError as e: test.disabled_message = ("Failed to connect to S3 with " "credentials, to find bucket. " "Got error: %s" % e) test.disabled = True return except TypeError as e: # This hack is necessary because of a bug in boto 1.9b: # http://code.google.com/p/boto/issues/detail?id=540 test.disabled_message = ("Failed to connect to S3 with " "credentials. Got error: %s" % e) test.disabled = True return test.s3_conn = s3_conn if not test.bucket: location = get_s3_location(test.s3_store_host) try: test.bucket = s3_conn.create_bucket(bucket_name, location=location) except S3ResponseError as e: test.disabled_message = ("Failed to create bucket. " "Got error: %s" % e) test.disabled = True return else: for key in test.bucket.list(): key.delete() def teardown_s3(test): if not test.disabled: # It's not possible to simply clear a bucket. You # need to loop over all the keys and delete them # all first... for key in test.bucket.list(): key.delete() test.s3_conn.delete_bucket(test.s3_store_bucket) def get_s3_uri(test, image_id): uri = ('s3://%(s3_store_access_key)s:%(s3_store_secret_key)s' % test.__dict__) uri += '@%(s3_conn)s/' % test.__dict__ uri += '%(s3_store_bucket)s/' % test.__dict__ uri += image_id return uri.replace('S3Connection:', '')

commit_message:
Replace xrange in for loop with range

xrange is not supported in python 3, so replace it with range.
It's not a large range size, so no need to use six.moves.range.

Change-Id: Ie62c3f1651d98f6b7d9a70fa1b485a9a04fd758f
Closes-Bug: #1264182

commit_message:
Fixed the invalid argument at subclass of webob.exc.WSGIHTTPException

If the specific error message is required, we must set
explanation='message'.
Ex.
OK: raise webob.exc.HTTPBadRequest(explanation='What?')
NG: raise webob.exc.HTTPBadRequest('What?')

Change-Id: I8d1adeb95cef455bfeb5a805c7f7db7bf05e236e
Closes-Bug: #1264223

deleted_lines: raise webob.exc.HTTPBadRequest("Must specify 'connector'") raise webob.exc.HTTPBadRequest("Must specify 'connector'")

commit_message:
Use model_query() in db.*****_destroy

Use model_query() instead of session.query in db.volume_destroy,
db.volume_type_destroy, db.transfer_destroy and db.snapshot_destroy as
other methods use.
model_query function is the query helper which is used in most part of
cinder/db/sqlalchemy/api.py.

Change-Id: I97be252df9d40bb97231e3341d5cedec26af2d93
Closes-Bug: #1256483
(cherry picked from commit d54c49a22e3ce147003cc9a926b7b72e8dc9c1a8)

commit_message:
Automatic login after password changed

Currently when a user changed the password successfully,
it will redirect to the login page, the user needs to
input the username and new password to relogin. This will
allow user to automatic login after password changed from
settings and users panal.

Implements blueprint auto-login-after-password-changed

Change-Id: I550f7738067a340cd2e2a89385099dcff22f56e0

commit_message:
Break metadata update tests (DO NOT MERGE)

This change illustrates how we can break metadata update tests in rather
innocent way.

DO NOT MERGE, just look and be scared ;)

Change-Id: Ie811634f8b54d72f41b635586571dd1429165b25

commit_message:
Remove remaining code from compute __init__

This commit just removes the remaining code from __init__.py in the
compute api directory. We don't want tempest to require a working
config or any other external requirements at import time.

Change-Id: Iec03167dc6e0502c83a1f4db216abd899d89545c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/06/60906/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Enable tests of Swift which does not use auth system

This patch enables functional tests for Swift which is not combined with
any auth system such as Keystone or TempAuth. Insert test skip annotations
to test codes which are invalid when auth system is not used.

Change-Id: Ia99dfb8f30de14b9f6b4f3ad9dd2ddb11d8d0755
Implements: blueprint swift-test-without-keystone

commit_message:
Modified novaclient endpoints command to filter region-wise

If nothing  specified it will display all the endpoints
available regardless of the regions

Change-Id: I021b5e3e3a15a5498dad10b2bdbd2feb41031efa
Closes-Bug: #1256009

commit_message:
Novaclient should use cliutils from oslo

Currently, it defines its own set of decorators to define
command line arguments. This code is exactly the same as that
in oslo.cliutils. Thus it would be easier to maintain the code
at one place.

Some more functions are duplicated. But those currently do not
work on py33 and needs to be fixed in oslo.cliutils

Change-Id: Ia85ecb00903713644e9584fde564a74d6d43f22e
Partial-Bug: #1261850
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-novaclient refs/changes/66/62866/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Copyright 2010 Jacob Kaplan-Moss # Copyright 2011 OpenStack Foundation # Copyright 2012 Grid Dynamics # Copyright 2013 OpenStack Foundation # All Rights Reserved. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. """ Base utilities to build API operation managers and objects on top of. """ # E1102: %s is not callable # pylint: disable=E1102 import abc import six from novaclient.openstack.common.apiclient import exceptions from novaclient.openstack.common.py3kcompat import urlutils from novaclient.openstack.common import strutils def getid(obj): """Return id if argument is a Resource. Abstracts the common pattern of allowing both an object or an object's ID (UUID) as a parameter when dealing with relationships. """ try: if obj.uuid: return obj.uuid except AttributeError: pass try: return obj.id except AttributeError: return obj # TODO(aababilov): call run_hooks() in HookableMixin's child classes class HookableMixin(object): """Mixin so classes can register and run hooks.""" _hooks_map = {} @classmethod def add_hook(cls, hook_type, hook_func): """Add a new hook of specified type. :param cls: class that registers hooks :param hook_type: hook type, e.g., '__pre_parse_args__' :param hook_func: hook function """ if hook_type not in cls._hooks_map: cls._hooks_map[hook_type] = [] cls._hooks_map[hook_type].append(hook_func) @classmethod def run_hooks(cls, hook_type, *args, **kwargs): """Run all hooks of specified type. :param cls: class that registers hooks :param hook_type: hook type, e.g., '__pre_parse_args__' :param **args: args to be passed to every hook function :param **kwargs: kwargs to be passed to every hook function """ hook_funcs = cls._hooks_map.get(hook_type) or [] for hook_func in hook_funcs: hook_func(*args, **kwargs) class BaseManager(HookableMixin): """Basic manager type providing common operations. Managers interact with a particular type of API (servers, flavors, images, etc.) and provide CRUD operations for them. """ resource_class = None def __init__(self, client): """Initializes BaseManager with `client`. :param client: instance of BaseClient descendant for HTTP requests """ super(BaseManager, self).__init__() self.client = client def _list(self, url, response_key, obj_class=None, json=None): """List the collection. :param url: a partial URL, e.g., '/servers' :param response_key: the key to be looked up in response dictionary, e.g., 'servers' :param obj_class: class for constructing the returned objects (self.resource_class will be used by default) :param json: data that will be encoded as JSON and passed in POST request (GET will be sent by default) """ if json: body = self.client.post(url, json=json).json() else: body = self.client.get(url).json() if obj_class is None: obj_class = self.resource_class data = body[response_key] # NOTE(ja): keystone returns values as list as {'values': [ ... ]} # unlike other services which just return the list... try: data = data['values'] except (KeyError, TypeError): pass return [obj_class(self, res, loaded=True) for res in data if res] def _get(self, url, response_key): """Get an object from collection. :param url: a partial URL, e.g., '/servers' :param response_key: the key to be looked up in response dictionary, e.g., 'server' """ body = self.client.get(url).json() return self.resource_class(self, body[response_key], loaded=True) def _head(self, url): """Retrieve request headers for an object. :param url: a partial URL, e.g., '/servers' """ resp = self.client.head(url) return resp.status_code == 204 def _post(self, url, json, response_key, return_raw=False): """Create an object. :param url: a partial URL, e.g., '/servers' :param json: data that will be encoded as JSON and passed in POST request (GET will be sent by default) :param response_key: the key to be looked up in response dictionary, e.g., 'servers' :param return_raw: flag to force returning raw JSON instead of Python object of self.resource_class """ body = self.client.post(url, json=json).json() if return_raw: return body[response_key] return self.resource_class(self, body[response_key]) def _put(self, url, json=None, response_key=None): """Update an object with PUT method. :param url: a partial URL, e.g., '/servers' :param json: data that will be encoded as JSON and passed in POST request (GET will be sent by default) :param response_key: the key to be looked up in response dictionary, e.g., 'servers' """ resp = self.client.put(url, json=json) # PUT requests may not return a body if resp.content: body = resp.json() if response_key is not None: return self.resource_class(self, body[response_key]) else: return self.resource_class(self, body) def _patch(self, url, json=None, response_key=None): """Update an object with PATCH method. :param url: a partial URL, e.g., '/servers' :param json: data that will be encoded as JSON and passed in POST request (GET will be sent by default) :param response_key: the key to be looked up in response dictionary, e.g., 'servers' """ body = self.client.patch(url, json=json).json() if response_key is not None: return self.resource_class(self, body[response_key]) else: return self.resource_class(self, body) def _delete(self, url): """Delete an object. :param url: a partial URL, e.g., '/servers/my-server' """ return self.client.delete(url) @six.add_metaclass(abc.ABCMeta) class ManagerWithFind(BaseManager): """Manager with additional `find()`/`findall()` methods.""" @abc.abstractmethod def list(self): pass def find(self, **kwargs): """Find a single item with attributes matching ``**kwargs``. This isn't very efficient: it loads the entire list then filters on the Python side. """ matches = self.findall(**kwargs) num_matches = len(matches) if num_matches == 0: msg = "No %s matching %s." % (self.resource_class.__name__, kwargs) raise exceptions.NotFound(msg) elif num_matches > 1: raise exceptions.NoUniqueMatch() else: return matches[0] def findall(self, **kwargs): """Find all items with attributes matching ``**kwargs``. This isn't very efficient: it loads the entire list then filters on the Python side. """ found = [] searches = kwargs.items() for obj in self.list(): try: if all(getattr(obj, attr) == value for (attr, value) in searches): found.append(obj) except AttributeError: continue return found class CrudManager(BaseManager): """Base manager class for manipulating entities. Children of this class are expected to define a `collection_key` and `key`. - `collection_key`: Usually a plural noun by convention (e.g. `entities`); used to refer collections in both URL's (e.g. `/v3/entities`) and JSON objects containing a list of member resources (e.g. `{'entities': [{}, {}, {}]}`). - `key`: Usually a singular noun by convention (e.g. `entity`); used to refer to an individual member of the collection. """ collection_key = None key = None def build_url(self, base_url=None, **kwargs): """Builds a resource URL for the given kwargs. Given an example collection where `collection_key = 'entities'` and `key = 'entity'`, the following URL's could be generated. By default, the URL will represent a collection of entities, e.g.:: /entities If kwargs contains an `entity_id`, then the URL will represent a specific member, e.g.:: /entities/{entity_id} :param base_url: if provided, the generated URL will be appended to it """ url = base_url if base_url is not None else '' url += '/%s' % self.collection_key # do we have a specific entity? entity_id = kwargs.get('%s_id' % self.key) if entity_id is not None: url += '/%s' % entity_id return url def _filter_kwargs(self, kwargs): """Drop null values and handle ids.""" for key, ref in six.iteritems(kwargs.copy()): if ref is None: kwargs.pop(key) else: if isinstance(ref, Resource): kwargs.pop(key) kwargs['%s_id' % key] = getid(ref) return kwargs def create(self, **kwargs): kwargs = self._filter_kwargs(kwargs) return self._post( self.build_url(**kwargs), {self.key: kwargs}, self.key) def get(self, **kwargs): kwargs = self._filter_kwargs(kwargs) return self._get( self.build_url(**kwargs), self.key) def head(self, **kwargs): kwargs = self._filter_kwargs(kwargs) return self._head(self.build_url(**kwargs)) def list(self, base_url=None, **kwargs): """List the collection. :param base_url: if provided, the generated URL will be appended to it """ kwargs = self._filter_kwargs(kwargs) return self._list( '%(base_url)s%(query)s' % { 'base_url': self.build_url(base_url=base_url, **kwargs), 'query': '?%s' % urlutils.urlencode(kwargs) if kwargs else '', }, self.collection_key) def put(self, base_url=None, **kwargs): """Update an element. :param base_url: if provided, the generated URL will be appended to it """ kwargs = self._filter_kwargs(kwargs) return self._put(self.build_url(base_url=base_url, **kwargs)) def update(self, **kwargs): kwargs = self._filter_kwargs(kwargs) params = kwargs.copy() params.pop('%s_id' % self.key) return self._patch( self.build_url(**kwargs), {self.key: params}, self.key) def delete(self, **kwargs): kwargs = self._filter_kwargs(kwargs) return self._delete( self.build_url(**kwargs)) def find(self, base_url=None, **kwargs): """Find a single item with attributes matching ``**kwargs``. :param base_url: if provided, the generated URL will be appended to it """ kwargs = self._filter_kwargs(kwargs) rl = self._list( '%(base_url)s%(query)s' % { 'base_url': self.build_url(base_url=base_url, **kwargs), 'query': '?%s' % urlutils.urlencode(kwargs) if kwargs else '', }, self.collection_key) num = len(rl) if num == 0: msg = "No %s matching %s." % (self.resource_class.__name__, kwargs) raise exceptions.NotFound(404, msg) elif num > 1: raise exceptions.NoUniqueMatch else: return rl[0] class Extension(HookableMixin): """Extension descriptor.""" SUPPORTED_HOOKS = ('__pre_parse_args__', '__post_parse_args__') manager_class = None def __init__(self, name, module): super(Extension, self).__init__() self.name = name self.module = module self._parse_extension_module() def _parse_extension_module(self): self.manager_class = None for attr_name, attr_value in self.module.__dict__.items(): if attr_name in self.SUPPORTED_HOOKS: self.add_hook(attr_name, attr_value) else: try: if issubclass(attr_value, BaseManager): self.manager_class = attr_value except TypeError: pass def __repr__(self): return "<Extension '%s'>" % self.name class Resource(object): """Base class for OpenStack resources (tenant, user, etc.). This is pretty much just a bag for attributes. """ HUMAN_ID = False NAME_ATTR = 'name' def __init__(self, manager, info, loaded=False): """Populate and bind to a manager. :param manager: BaseManager object :param info: dictionary representing resource attributes :param loaded: prevent lazy-loading if set to True """ self.manager = manager self._info = info self._add_details(info) self._loaded = loaded def __repr__(self): reprkeys = sorted(k for k in self.__dict__.keys() if k[0] != '_' and k != 'manager') info = ", ".join("%s=%s" % (k, getattr(self, k)) for k in reprkeys) return "<%s %s>" % (self.__class__.__name__, info) @property def human_id(self): """Human-readable ID which can be used for bash completion. """ if self.NAME_ATTR in self.__dict__ and self.HUMAN_ID: return strutils.to_slug(getattr(self, self.NAME_ATTR)) return None def _add_details(self, info): for (k, v) in six.iteritems(info): try: setattr(self, k, v) self._info[k] = v except AttributeError: # In this case we already defined the attribute on the class pass def __getattr__(self, k): if k not in self.__dict__: #NOTE(bcwaldon): disallow lazy-loading if already loaded once if not self.is_loaded(): self.get() return self.__getattr__(k) raise AttributeError(k) else: return self.__dict__[k] def get(self): # set_loaded() first ... so if we have to bail, we know we tried. self.set_loaded(True) if not hasattr(self.manager, 'get'): return new = self.manager.get(self.id) if new: self._add_details(new._info) def __eq__(self, other): if not isinstance(other, Resource): return NotImplemented # two resources of different types are not equal if not isinstance(other, self.__class__): return False if hasattr(self, 'id') and hasattr(other, 'id'): return self.id == other.id return self._info == other._info def is_loaded(self): return self._loaded def set_loaded(self, val): self._loaded = val

subject: Have tox install via setup.py develop
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-12-11 17:01:28.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/oslo.config/commit/f527e5a17bbf72597f162f12c568ef17e1fe2fbb', 'message': 'Have tox install via setup.py develop

tox 1.6 was released, which means that we can now take advantage of
the feature we added to it - which is using setup.py develop to
install the code into the virtualenv. The logic was taken from
run_tests.sh - so the performance issues around using tox vs. using
install_venv should now be gone.

Additionally, override the tox pip install command to avoid using the
"--pre" option which is the default in tox.  "--pre" means "Include
pre-release and development versions."  By default, pip will only
install stable versions of software, and that is the behavior we want.

Change-Id: Ida5e440d1bdb9f8e9031277ea53a02d2ef171438
Co-Authored-By: Monty Taylor <mordred@inaugust.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Have tox install via setup.py develop

tox 1.6 was released, which means that we can now take advantage of
the feature we added to it - which is using setup.py develop to
install the code into the virtualenv. The logic was taken from
run_tests.sh - so the performance issues around using tox vs. using
install_venv should now be gone.

Additionally, override the tox pip install command to avoid using the
"--pre" option which is the default in tox.  "--pre" means "Include
pre-release and development versions."  By default, pip will only
install stable versions of software, and that is the behavior we want.

Change-Id: Ida5e440d1bdb9f8e9031277ea53a02d2ef171438
Co-Authored-By: Monty Taylor <mordred@inaugust.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo.config refs/changes/97/61497/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Fix: Heat test deletes the same stack twice

When BaseOrchestrationTest.tearDownClass is called, it tries to
delete the stack that was created (and already deleted) in
test_stack_crud_no_resources.  This patch removes the stack from the
stacks list to prevent that from happening.

Change-Id: Iaad6d3bb0b9c1f9289a7907fe8c082baeceeba27
Closes-Bug: #1262286

commit_message:
Avoid all usages of locals() in string formatting operations

This fixes all occurences of Hacking warning H501, string
formatting should not use locals().

Change-Id: I575f797a3251fe6efa603d4d5b0b49616cc88eef

commit_message:
Catch NotImplementedError for spice in the api

When a driver doesn't provide spice consoles, it will raise
NotImplementedError back up to the API.  Catch this and return a 501.

Change-Id: Ib417ad7627d07d6b26abfa171f346e4e63f612ca

commit_message:
Clean up the test cases to use the real UUID

Object models have a UUID field type and expect to check is_uuid_like.
If the strings like 'fake-uuid' are used, the check will fail.
The patch is to replace the 'fake-uuid' like strings with the real UUIDs.

Change-Id: I96a68dc3b2531f87fa8c8498e9d4f6b50ed905a0

commit_message:
Add error check to baselineCPU call in libvirt driver

In some cases getbaselineCPU returns -1. This changes adds a check for
that in addition to None to avoid a subsequent failure when attempting
to parse the return value as a string.

Change-Id: I925efaf100b380c548b1216a6affe6bd1b37a437
Closes-Bug: #1261938

commit_message:
Refactors network scenario test to support more network tests

1. Moves some functions of TestNetworkBasicOps class to
scenario/manager.py.
2. Changes variables management style in TestNetworkBasicOps
class. Moves variables(keypairs, security_groups, networks etc.)
defination from setUpClass function to test function.

Change-Id: I51e7884fd24ae3d09889203691d43ab23f4d9ecf
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/98/59898/16 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # vim: tabstop=4 shiftwidth=4 softtabstop=4 # Copyright 2012 OpenStack Foundation # Copyright 2013 Hewlett-Packard Development Company, L.P. # All Rights Reserved. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. from tempest.common import debug from tempest.openstack.common import log as logging from tempest.scenario.network import base_network_ops from tempest.test import attr from tempest.test import services LOG = logging.getLogger(__name__) class TestNetworkBasicOps(base_network_ops.BaseNetworkOps): """ This smoke test suite assumes that Nova has been configured to boot VM's with Neutron-managed networking, and attempts to verify network connectivity as follows: * For a freshly-booted VM with an IP address ("port") on a given network: - the Tempest host can ping the IP address. This implies, but does not guarantee (see the ssh check that follows), that the VM has been assigned the correct IP address and has connectivity to the Tempest host. - the Tempest host can perform key-based authentication to an ssh server hosted at the IP address. This check guarantees that the IP address is associated with the target VM. # TODO(mnewby) - Need to implement the following: - the Tempest host can ssh into the VM via the IP address and successfully execute the following: - ping an external IP address, implying external connectivity. - ping an external hostname, implying that dns is correctly configured. - ping an internal IP address, implying connectivity to another VM on the same network. There are presumed to be two types of networks: tenant and public. A tenant network may or may not be reachable from the Tempest host. A public network is assumed to be reachable from the Tempest host, and it should be possible to associate a public ('floating') IP address with a tenant ('fixed') IP address to facilitate external connectivity to a potentially unroutable tenant IP address. This test suite can be configured to test network connectivity to a VM via a tenant network, a public network, or both. If both networking types are to be evaluated, tests that need to be executed remotely on the VM (via ssh) will only be run against one of the networks (to minimize test execution time). Determine which types of networks to test as follows: * Configure tenant network checks (via the 'tenant_networks_reachable' key) if the Tempest host should have direct connectivity to tenant networks. This is likely to be the case if Tempest is running on the same host as a single-node devstack installation with IP namespaces disabled. * Configure checks for a public network if a public network has been configured prior to the test suite being run and if the Tempest host should have connectivity to that public network. Checking connectivity for a public network requires that a value be provided for 'public_network_id'. A value can optionally be provided for 'public_router_id' if tenants will use a shared router to access a public network (as is likely to be the case when IP namespaces are not enabled). If a value is not provided for 'public_router_id', a router will be created for each tenant and use the network identified by 'public_network_id' as its gateway. """ def _check_tenant_network_connectivity(self): if not self.config.network.tenant_networks_reachable: msg = 'Tenant networks not configured to be reachable.' LOG.info(msg) return # The target login is assumed to have been configured for # key-based authentication by cloud-init. ssh_login = self.config.compute.image_ssh_user private_key = self.keypairs[self.tenant_id].private_key for server in self.servers: for net_name, ip_addresses in server.networks.iteritems(): for ip_address in ip_addresses: self._check_vm_connectivity(ip_address, ssh_login, private_key) def _check_public_network_connectivity(self): # The target login is assumed to have been configured for # key-based authentication by cloud-init. ssh_login = self.config.compute.image_ssh_user private_key = self.keypairs[self.tenant_id].private_key try: for server, floating_ips in self.floating_ips.iteritems(): for floating_ip in floating_ips: ip_address = floating_ip.floating_ip_address self._check_vm_connectivity(ip_address, ssh_login, private_key) except Exception as exc: LOG.exception(exc) debug.log_ip_ns() raise exc @attr(type='smoke') @services('compute', 'network') def test_network_basic_ops(self): self._create_keypairs() self._create_security_groups() self._create_networks() self._check_networks() self._create_servers() self._assign_floating_ips() self._check_public_network_connectivity() self._check_tenant_network_connectivity()

commit_message:
make cms token id URL safe

Previous cms token id's were not URL safe nor did they use RFC
compliant encodings. Use urlsafe base64 encoding as described in
RFC-4648 to generate the cms token id. Also strip the trailing pad
character(s) as suggested in RFC-4648 to be fully URL safe. Use
Python's base64.urlsafe_b64encode() and base64.urlsafe_b64decode() to
perform the encode/decode operations. See bug report for complete
issue description. The implementation utilizes functions in
keystone.common.base64utils and keystone.common.pem_utils which appear
in prior commit for this bug.

Change-Id: I85c53669e86e301d3a89ca413a5520b582d754d3
Fixes-Bug: #1233838
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone refs/changes/53/49453/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import base64from keystone.common import base64_utilsfrom keystone.common import pem_utilsdef cms_pem_to_token_id(cms_pem): '''Convert cms pem to a token_id which is URL safe The cms data will be encoded in base64 to be used as a token id. token id's are utilized in various HTTP contexts: * URL components * HTTP header values Therefore it is essential the token id be safe to use in these contexts. Standard base64 is NOT safe. base64url text is designed to be safe for use in filenames and URL's. It is defined in RFC-4648 Section 5. base64url differs from base64 in the last two alphabet characters at index 62 and 63, these are sometimes referred as the altchars. The '+' character at index 62 is replaced by '-' (hyphen) and the '/' character at index 63 is replaced by '_' (underscore). base64url continues to use the '=' pad character which is NOT URL safe. RFC-4648 suggests two alternate methods to deal with this. percent-encode percent-encode the pad character (e.g. '=' becomes '%3D'). This makes the base64url text fully safe. But percent-enconding has the downside of requiring percent-decoding prior to feeding the base64url text into a base64url decoder since most base64url decoders do not recognize %3D as a pad character and most decoders require correct padding. no-padding padding is not strictly necessary to decode base64 or base64url text, the pad can be computed from the input text length. However many decoders demand padding and will consider non-padded text to be malformed. If one wants to omit the trailing pad character(s) for use in URL's it can be added back using the base64_utils.base64_assure_padding() function. For our use we elect to strip the padding rather than percent-encode the padding. This makes the token id slightly shorter and cleaner. :param cms_pem: text containing cms data in PEM format :returns: a URL safe token_id ''' # Extract the bindary data from the PEM formatted input binary_data = pem_utils.get_pem_data(cms_pem, 'cms') if binary_data is None: raise ValueError('no pem found in cms_pem') # Encode binary data with a URL safe base64 alphabet text = base64.urlsafe_b64encode(binary_data) # Strip the padding because it's not URL safe token_id = base64_utils.base64_strip_padding(text) return token_id def token_id_to_cms_pem(token_id): '''Convert a URL safe token_id to cms data in PEM format See cms_pem_to_token_id() for a full explanation of how the token id encodes the cms data. :param token_id: a URL safe string containing CMS data :returns: cms data in PEM format ''' # Restore padding because urlsafe_b64decode demands correct padding text = base64_utils.base64_assure_padding(token_id) # Decode the URL safe base64 back into binary data binary_data = base64.urlsafe_b64decode(text) # Format the binary data into PEM format cms_pem = pem_utils.binary_to_pem(binary_data, 'cms') return cms_pem return cms_verify(token_id_to_cms_pem(token), return cms_pem_to_token_id(output)
deleted_lines:
def token_to_cms(signed_text): copy_of_text = signed_text.replace('-', '/') formatted = "-----BEGIN CMS-----
" line_length = 64 while len(copy_of_text) > 0: if (len(copy_of_text) > line_length): formatted += copy_of_text[:line_length] copy_of_text = copy_of_text[line_length:] else: formatted += copy_of_text copy_of_text = "" formatted += "
" formatted += "-----END CMS-----
" return formatted return cms_verify(token_to_cms(token), return cms_to_token(output) def cms_to_token(cms_text): start_delim = "-----BEGIN CMS-----" end_delim = "-----END CMS-----" signed_text = cms_text signed_text = signed_text.replace('/', '-') signed_text = signed_text.replace(start_delim, '') signed_text = signed_text.replace(end_delim, '') signed_text = signed_text.replace('
', '') return signed_text

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-12-25 01:52:52.000000000', 'files': ['glance/common/utils.py', 'glance/api/v1/images.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/glance/commit/ce817bf3bb18add441b3c781d67d03cfb7fa876f', 'message': "Disallow negative image sizes

Currently Glance v1 allows creation of images with negative sizes when
the source URL provided by the --location parmeter does not exist at

There is already a check to verify whether or not an image size can be
converted to an int but the check doesn't verify whether or not the
resulting value is >= 0. This commit supplements that check to
disallow negative values for the size parameter.

Change-Id: I2ae648c4a3e17f6ffb03a635eef9098d79ea8a2b
Closes-Bug: #1260738
"}]
commit_message:
Disallow negative image sizes

Currently Glance v1 allows creation of images with negative sizes when
the source URL provided by the --location parmeter does not exist at
the time of creation.

There is already a check to verify whether or not an image size can be
converted to an int but the check doesn't verify whether or not the
resulting value is >= 0. This commit supplements that check to
disallow negative values for the size parameter.

Change-Id: I2ae648c4a3e17f6ffb03a635eef9098d79ea8a2b
Closes-Bug: #1260738
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/glance refs/changes/80/63980/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: "an integer.") % image_size_str

commit_message:
POC: rolling upgrade test for nova-compute

This is a hard coded proof of concept of a rolling upgrade test for
nova-compute.  Nova wants to support the ability to run stable/havana
nova-compute with icehouse everything else. This sets up a test for
that.

Full support for this will come in a separate series of patches. This is
to just show the idea.

Change-Id: I157ff04d3c03fc925e44e05a7fa45011c481aa83
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/grenade refs/changes/70/64070/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

subject: Revert "Fix workspace setup"
revisions: [{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-12-25 16:15:38.000000000', 'files': ['test-functions.sh', 'devstack-vm-gate-wrap.sh', 'functions.sh'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/devstack-gate/commit/830cf239cda3bcff01c7adbdf5cc712b3551b1bf', 'message': 'Revert "Fix workspace setup"\n\nThis reverts commit 4d2f0e7c8572c9587e51ebfbd940c95c10e754a5'}]
commit_message:
Revert "Fix workspace setup"

This reverts commit 4d2f0e7c8572c9587e51ebfbd940c95c10e754a5
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack-gate refs/changes/50/64050/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # do all the zuulification magic for project at a specified branch# The basic logic flow is as follows: # if we have ``branch`` for project, check that out # if we don't have ``branch`` for project, change ``branch`` to master # and check that out # if the global ZUUL_BRANCH matches ``branch``, then also look for a # valid ZUUL_REF, and use that instead of the HEAD of the branch# The end result is a tree on disk checked out at the right ref for zuul if [ -n "$OVERRIDE_ZUUL_BRANCH" ] ; then OVERRIDE_ZUUL_REF=$(echo $ZUUL_REF | sed -e "s,$branch,$OVERRIDE_ZUUL_BRANCH,") fi branch=master # See if we should check out a Zuul ref if [ "$ZUUL_BRANCH" == "$branch" ]; then # See if Zuul prepared a ref for this project if git_fetch_at_ref $project $OVERRIDE_ZUUL_REF || \ git_fetch_at_ref $project $ZUUL_REF || \ git_fetch_at_ref $project $FALLBACK_ZUUL_REF; then # It's there, so check it out. git_checkout $project FETCH_HEAD if [ "$project" == "$ZUUL_PROJECT" ]; then echo "Unable to find ref $ZUUL_REF for $project" exit 1 fi git_checkout $project $branch else # We're ignoring Zuul refs git_checkout $project $branch
deleted_lines: # Set up a project in accordance with the future state proposed by # Zuul.# Arguments: # project: The full name of the project to set up # branch: The branch to check out# The branch argument should be the desired branch to check out. If # you have no other opinions, then you should supply ZUUL_BRANCH here # (or leave it empty which will have the same effect). This is # generally the branch corresponding with the change being tested. # # If you would like to check out a branch other than what ZUUL has # selected, for example in order to check out the old or new branches # for grenade, or an alternate branch to test client library # compatability, then supply that as the argument instead. This # function will try to check out the following (in order): # # The zuul ref for the indicated branch # The zuul ref for the zuul branch # The zuul ref for the master branch # The tip of the indicated branch # The tip of the master branch # # Try the specified branch before the ZUUL_BRANCH. OVERRIDE_ZUUL_REF=$(echo $ZUUL_REF | sed -e "s,$ZUUL_BRANCH,$branch,") # See if Zuul prepared a ref for this project if git_fetch_at_ref $project $OVERRIDE_ZUUL_REF || \ git_fetch_at_ref $project $ZUUL_REF || \ git_fetch_at_ref $project $FALLBACK_ZUUL_REF; then # It's there, so check it out. git_checkout $project FETCH_HEAD else if [ "$project" == "$ZUUL_PROJECT" ]; then echo "Unable to find ref $ZUUL_REF for $project" exit 1 fi if git_has_branch $project $branch; then git_checkout $project $branch git_checkout $project master

commit_message:
Fix workspace setup

Stable branch overrides for client testing, devstack-gate alternate-branch
testing, and grenade old/new branch selection are all actually the same
thing.  Update setup_project to reflect that, fixing all known bugs in
the process.  Note that some jobs will need to be updated to pass in
OVERRIDE_ZUUL_BRANCH.

Change-Id: I6613715439bed9914b8444e335fac5eab4d14075
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack-gate refs/changes/72/63972/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Set up a project in accordance with the future state proposed by # Zuul.# Arguments: # project: The full name of the project to set up # branch: The branch to check out# The branch argument should be the desired branch to check out. If # you have no other opinions, then you should supply ZUUL_BRANCH here # (or leave it empty which will have the same effect). This is # generally the branch corresponding with the change being tested. # # If you would like to check out a branch other than what ZUUL has # selected, for example in order to check out the old or new branches # for grenade, or an alternate branch to test client library # compatability, then supply that as the argument instead. This # function will try to check out the following (in order): # # The zuul ref for the indicated branch # The zuul ref for the zuul branch # The zuul ref for the master branch # The tip of the indicated branch # The tip of the master branch # # Try the specified branch before the ZUUL_BRANCH. OVERRIDE_ZUUL_REF=$(echo $ZUUL_REF | sed -e "s,$ZUUL_BRANCH,$branch,") # See if Zuul prepared a ref for this project if git_fetch_at_ref $project $OVERRIDE_ZUUL_REF || \ git_fetch_at_ref $project $ZUUL_REF || \ git_fetch_at_ref $project $FALLBACK_ZUUL_REF; then # It's there, so check it out. git_checkout $project FETCH_HEAD if [ "$project" == "$ZUUL_PROJECT" ]; then echo "Unable to find ref $ZUUL_REF for $project" exit 1 fi if git_has_branch $project $branch; then git_checkout $project $branch else git_checkout $project master fi
deleted_lines: # do all the zuulification magic for project at a specified branch# The basic logic flow is as follows: # if we have ``branch`` for project, check that out # if we don't have ``branch`` for project, change ``branch`` to master # and check that out # if the global ZUUL_BRANCH matches ``branch``, then also look for a # valid ZUUL_REF, and use that instead of the HEAD of the branch# The end result is a tree on disk checked out at the right ref for zuul if [ -n "$OVERRIDE_ZUUL_BRANCH" ] ; then OVERRIDE_ZUUL_REF=$(echo $ZUUL_REF | sed -e "s,$branch,$OVERRIDE_ZUUL_BRANCH,") fi branch=master # See if we should check out a Zuul ref if [ "$ZUUL_BRANCH" == "$branch" ]; then # See if Zuul prepared a ref for this project if git_fetch_at_ref $project $OVERRIDE_ZUUL_REF || \ git_fetch_at_ref $project $ZUUL_REF || \ git_fetch_at_ref $project $FALLBACK_ZUUL_REF; then # It's there, so check it out. git_checkout $project FETCH_HEAD else if [ "$project" == "$ZUUL_PROJECT" ]; then echo "Unable to find ref $ZUUL_REF for $project" exit 1 fi git_checkout $project $branch fi # We're ignoring Zuul refs git_checkout $project $branch

added_lines: def test_neutron_l3_gateway(self): cluster = self.create_env('multinode', 'gre') test_gateway = "192.168.111.255" public_ng = self.db.query(NetworkGroup).filter( NetworkGroup.name == 'public' ).filter( NetworkGroup.cluster_id == cluster.id ).first() public_ng.gateway = test_gateway self.db.add(public_ng) self.db.commit() facts = self.serializer.serialize(cluster, cluster.nodes) pd_nets = facts[0]["quantum_settings"]["predefined_networks"] self.assertEquals( pd_nets["net04_ext"]["L3"]["gateway"], test_gateway )

commit_message:
Not Running error should not fail haproxy_restart

Change-Id: Ia4638b68e2042877fbf495fdba0308eebaa5d7c2
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-library refs/changes/45/63945/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # get pid from pidfile # check if process exists if ps -p "${PID}" | grep -q haproxy; then # get pid from pidfile PID="`cat ${PIDFILE}`" ocf_log info "Haproxy daemon is not running. Starting it." haproxy_start
deleted_lines: if ps -p "${PID}" | grep haproxy >/dev/null ; then ocf_log info "haproxy daemon is not running" return $OCF_NOT_RUNNING

subject: Adds guard against upload contention
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-10-17 15:02:17.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/glance/commit/b34f23f015d1891330855c46ec1f137372898ac5', 'message': "Adds guard against upload contention.

There are at least two ways to sort this out. The proper way would
be to implement a new taskflow for (at least) uploads thus avoiding
issues if the Glance service dies. This interim solution is simply
to guard against requests occuring during the processing of a valid
upload request by refusing to service any further requests while
the image is still 'saving'.

Fixes: bug 1241025
Change-Id: Ie532b61484bec660910fb9a37429397bde8ef11f

We now allow the upload activation to specify what state
it expects to transition to 'active' from. If by the time
the db is updated the transition has already occured i.e.
another upload has succeeded, the upload will fail and data
will be cleaned up.

Fixes: bug 1241025
Change-Id: Ie532b61484bec660910fb9a37429397bde8ef11f
"}, {'number': 10, 'created': '2013-12-09 19:43:17.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/glance/commit/8cf2e307e35a72c17a2af48bdf60996cf7992b6f', 'message': "Adds guard against upload contention

Protect against concurrent image uploads by allwing the
initial request to proceed and succeed and subsequent
concurrent requests to fail.

We now allow the upload activation to specify what state
it expects to transition to 'active' from. If by the time
the db is updated the transition has already occured i.e.
another upload has succeeded, the upload will fail and data
will be cleaned up.

commit_message:
Adds guard against upload contention

Protect against concurrent image uploads by allowing the
initial request to proceed and succeed and subsequent
concurrent requests to fail.

We now allow the upload activation to specify what state
it expects to transition to 'active' from. If by the time
the db is updated the transition has already occured i.e.
another upload has succeeded, the upload will fail and data
will be cleaned up.

Fixes: bug 1241025
Change-Id: Ie532b61484bec660910fb9a37429397bde8ef11f

commit_message:
Add option for enabling debug logs only for OpenStack

A new option --debug-openstack-only was introduced to enable debug logs
for OpenStack components, but not for external ones (e.g. ampq). Synced
from oslo-incubator.

Change-Id: I635af310896a11cab0d16756ec3d03b942454dcf
Closes-Bug: #1207576
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/23/64023/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: cfg.BoolOpt('debug-openstack-only', default=False, help='Print debugging output only for OpenStack components, ' 'but not for third party libraries.'), if CONF.debug and not CONF.debug_openstack_only: logger = logging.getLogger(name) # In some places root logger is also accessed via this function, # but we should not set debug level on it. if CONF.debug_openstack_only and logger is not logging.getLogger(): logger.setLevel(logging.DEBUG) _loggers[name] = ContextAdapter(logger, name, version)
deleted_lines: if CONF.debug: _loggers[name] = ContextAdapter(logging.getLogger(name), name, version)

commit_message:
Refactoring driver interfaces

Added method create_share_form_snapshot to
manila.share.driver.ShareDriver.

Removed methods allocate_container, allocate_container_from_snapshot,
create_export, deallocate_container, remove_export

Implements bp refacto-driver-interfaces

Change-Id: I9f1c26b189f50aedc8e19864a172557700adf849

commit_message:
Ensure that mysql traditional mode is enabled

To avoid *silent* truncation of columns in mysql
it is much safer to turn on traditional mode which
behaves in the normal manner.

From the mysql docs:

Make MySQL behave like a "traditional" SQL database system.
A simple description of this mode is "give an error instead
of a warning" when inserting an incorrect value into a column.

Change-Id: Ic62af8514c377d2b8c934449116498855e03d7bd
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/taskflow refs/changes/91/63591/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def _set_mode_traditional(dbapi_con, con_record): """Set engine mode to 'traditional'. Required to prevent silent truncates at insert or update operations under MySQL. By default MySQL truncates inserted string if it longer than a declared field just with warning. That is fraught with data corruption. """ dbapi_con.cursor().execute("SET SESSION sql_mode = TRADITIONAL;") if misc.as_bool(conf.pop('mysql_traditional_mode', True)): sa.event.listen(engine, 'checkout', _set_mode_traditional)

commit_message:
Move async utils to own file

Instead of mixing eventlet related utility
functionality with async utility functionality
it seems to make sense to seperate those types
into two different files.

Change-Id: I8770fa5163feaa5f3666d36bf55d9aa30ca1b15f

commit_message:
Add --object-name

Add parameter --object-name, which:
1) Sets target object name when upload single file
2) Sets object prefix when upload a directory

Change-Id: Idc4357c3355e66d31c100540b901e70db20b03c3
Closes-Bug: 1012979
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-swiftclient refs/changes/14/61914/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: [--object-name <object-name>] --object-name <object-name> Upload file and name object to <object-name>. parser.add_option( '', '--object-name', dest='object_name', help='Upload file and name object to the name specified') if options.object_name is not None: object_name = options.object_name object_name.replace("\\", "/") obj = object_name if options.object_name is not None: if len(args[1:]) > 1: thread_manager.error('object-name only be used with 1 file') return elif isdir(args[1]): thread_manager.error('object-name cannot be used with directory') return

subject: Validate target host by scheduler
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-09-06 15:36:43.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/81c30db9b99161fde0cdb63328efcf2545d538e5', 'message': "Validate target host with scheduler hints for live migration

In the current implementation, when we boot a server we can
provide additional placement information through the scheduler
hints mechanism. However, when we live migrate a server those
scheduler hints are not taken into account.

This patch adds the ability to check if the target host passes
scheduler hints before live migration. To achieve that task those
hints are persisted as a json blob into the database.

This additional verification can lead the system locked, for
instance two hosts which run servers that must be located on
different hosts can't be migrated. Thus, an option
'no-check-by-scheduler' has been set up in order to make this
verification optional.

blueprint validate-targethost-live-migration
Fixes: bug #1198977
Fixes: bug #1039065

Change-Id: I38e198283332bedc5473246c69feab1ef9693a72

commit_message:
Validate target host by scheduler

In the current implementation, when we boot a server we can
provide additional placement information through the scheduler
hints mechanism. However, when we live migrate a server those
scheduler hints are not taken into account.

This patch adds the ability to check if the target host passes
filters before live migration. To achieve that task those
hints are persisted as a json blob into the database.

This additional verification can leave the system locked, for
instance two hosts which run servers that must be located on
different hosts can't be migrated. Thus, an option
'no-check-by-scheduler' has been set up in order to make this
verification optional.

DocImpact

blueprint validate-targethost-live-migration
Fixes: bug #1198977
Fixes: bug #1039065

Change-Id: I38e198283332bedc5473246c69feab1ef9693a72

commit_message:
Fix usage of get() methods in python clients

Here, we replace passing the reference to a resource to the get() method of
python client managers by passing the ID of the resource. While the previous
approach worked for Nova, it turned out to be a bug in Cinder.

We also fix the list/dict objects used as the parameter defaults, which is
a bad approach as well.

Change-Id: I9baa805b0aa3f7ccc704a2fa64a057858034977c
Closes-Bug: #1263770

commit_message:
Have tox install via setup.py develop

tox 1.6 was released, which means that we can now take advantage of the
feature we added to it - which is using setup.py develop to install the
code into the virtualenv. The logic was taken from run_tests.sh - so the
performance issues around using tox vs. using install_venv should now be
gone.

run_tests.sh is still needed to handle the ui switching between
parallel, single and debug modes to testr.

Original change to Nova: Ida5e440d1bdb9f8e9031277ea53a02d2ef171438

Change-Id: I946f2255ea6d47d1e99676e21da9e06620b1c779
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/glance refs/changes/13/64013/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Support for Windows in Virtualbox scripts

Added support for Cygwin.
Increased default disk and memory sizes for compatibility with Heat.
Added checks for non-installed Cygwin components.
Default NIC type changed to faster AMD PCnet FAST III.
Added check on network settings application.
Added trick to increase network configuration stability under Windows.
Changed hard-coded interface addition part to automatic loop.
Removed extra whitespaces.
Changed Fuel Web to Mirantis OpenStack
Rebased to latest commit.

Closes-Bug: #1252314
Change-Id: I466ebec87506eade5164de7d27d73f10dbbea0d9

commit_message:
allow hypervisors to be down but still pass

This test case is pretty raw, but it does make some invalid
assumptions about using the first hypervisor for everything. In
the uptime case it really needs to loop over all of them otherwise
if the first hypervisor is disabled this will fail.

This also does a cleanup refactoring of the hypervisor list check.

Change-Id: I9c3db794269f61aaaa55d432b14edf2d0fd1c774
Closes-Bug: #1193194

commit_message:
Added step to make sure 'root_helper' key references 'neutron'

In the current Neutron Havana packages for RHEL-style distributions,
the default 'root_helper' key in neutron.conf references 'quantum'
instead of 'neutron'. This issue should get fixed upstream, but in
the meantime I added a step to make sure this key references
'neutron'.

Change-Id: I25f9faaba1067040829633aff990d238f5bf4ced
backport: havana
Closes-Bug: #1258309
(cherry picked from commit 5dc7f610d57b79ac133b48725df1c669f525add8)

Fix computeroutput usage

Fix two wrong markup usages.

Change-Id: Ifda2b68f26c54f16ae5aff4d23bb2d46bcf0e990

commit_message:
Fixed AMQP configuration steps for Block Storage

I fixed the AMQP configuration steps in cinder.conf for Block Storage
on both controller and service nodes. I also unified structure and
phrasing with other portions of the guide and mentioned replacing
'RABBIT_PASS'. This patch affects all distributions.

I also found and fixed a minor issue causing several database
configuration instructions for other distributions to leak into those
for Debian which uses Debconf.

Change-Id: Ifd6f185b422195a00aad6efa83418d34b93eac85
backport: havana
Closes-Bug: #1244781
(cherry picked from commit a5fd95d740fa0e6c992dfdd401e2e64d050e5600)

commit_message:
Moves negative tests from api/compute/servers/test_virtual_interfaces

This change set moves the negative tests in test_virtual_interfaces to
a new file test_virtual_interfaces_negative

Also changes line # 43, rand_name(#$%*&^%) to uuid4() to get the invalid
server ID in negative file and removes usage of modules directly.

Note: HACKING.rst
The second requirement is that all negative tests must be added to a negative
test file. If such a file doesn't exist for the particular resource being
tested a new test file should be added

Change-Id: Ia6b4c927112318b5b6b4583511537d1cbe020f56

See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import uuid from tempest.api.compute import base from tempest import config from tempest import exceptions from tempest.test import attr class VirtualInterfacesNegativeTestJSON(base.BaseV2ComputeTest): _interface = 'json' CONF = config.TempestConfig() @classmethod def setUpClass(cls): super(VirtualInterfacesNegativeTestJSON, cls).setUpClass() cls.client = cls.servers_client resp, server = cls.create_test_server(wait_until='ACTIVE') cls.server_id = server['id'] @attr(type=['negative', 'gate']) def test_list_virtual_interfaces_invalid_server_id(self): # Negative test: Should not be able to GET virtual interfaces # for an invalid server_id invalid_server_id = str(uuid.uuid4()) self.assertRaises(exceptions.NotFound, self.client.list_virtual_interfaces, invalid_server_id) class VirtualInterfacesNegativeTestXML(VirtualInterfacesNegativeTestJSON): _interface = 'xml'

commit_message:
Enable HostsAdminTestXML

Although there is hosts_client class for XML, HostsAdminTestXML is
disabled. This patch enables HostsAdminTestXML.

Change-Id: Ib136661107a94f3e2c1607dad644dce0a3b42502
Closes-Bug: #1261968
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/06/60406/16 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: self.hosts_client = HostsClientJSON(*client_args)

added_lines: node_groups = values.pop("node_groups") or []def _templates_relation_get(context, session, cluster_template_id): query = model_query(m.TemplatesRelation, context, session) return query.filter_by(cluster_template_id=cluster_template_id).first() def cluster_template_update(context, cluster_template_id, values): values = values.copy() node_groups = values.pop("node_groups") or [] session = get_session() with session.begin(): try: cluster_template = _cluster_template_get(context, session, cluster_template_id) cluster_template.update(values) cluster_template.save(session=session) tmpl = _templates_relation_get(context, session, cluster_template_id) while(tmpl): session.delete(tmpl) tmpl = _templates_relation_get(context, session, cluster_template_id) except db_exc.DBDuplicateEntry as e: raise ex.DBDuplicateEntry("Duplicate entry for ClusterTemplate: %s" % e.columns) try: for ng in node_groups: node_group = m.TemplatesRelation() node_group.update({"cluster_template_id": cluster_template.id}) node_group.update(ng) node_group.save(session=session) except db_exc.DBDuplicateEntry as e: raise ex.DBDuplicateEntry("Duplicate entry for TemplatesRelation:" "%s" % e.columns) return cluster_template_get(context, cluster_template.id)

subject: Fix JSON serilization in objects
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-12-24 07:27:19.000000000', 'files': ['nova/objects/base.py', 'nova/tests/objects/test_objects.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/8a86a54d9e0a751c99301dac46c6f313bfac5431', 'message': 'Fix JSON serilization in objects

The test case will check whether JSON serializable by json.dumps()
instead of jsonutils.dumps(). An error will happen like the following:

TypeError: <nova.objects.flavor.Flavor object at 0x4e8a150> is not
JSON serializable.

The patch is to add support to json serialization.

commit_message:
Fix JSON serilization in objects

The test case will check whether JSON serializable by json.dumps()
instead of jsonutils.dumps(). An error will happen like the following:

TypeError: <nova.objects.flavor.Flavor object at 0x4e8a150> is not
JSON serializable.

The patch is to add support to json serialization.

Change-Id: I686f9c34b915c369439947d79ad1df627428a424
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/80/63880/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import json def test_json_support(self): class MyList(base.ObjectListBase, base.NovaObject): fields = {'objects': fields.ListOfObjectsField('MyObj')} expected = {"nova_object.version": "1.5", "nova_object.changes": ["foo", "bar"], "nova_object.name": "MyObj", "nova_object.data": {"foo": 1, "bar": "foo"}, "nova_object.namespace": "nova"} myobj = MyObj(foo=1, bar='foo') myobj = json.loads(json.dumps(myobj)) self.assertEqual(myobj.foo, 1) self.assertEqual(myobj.bar, 'foo') self.assertEqual(myobj.obj_to_primitive(), expected) mylist = MyList(objects=[MyObj(foo=1, bar='foo'), MyObj(foo=2, bar='bar')]) mylist = json.loads(json.dumps(mylist)) self.assertEqual(mylist[0].foo, 1) self.assertEqual(mylist[0].bar, 'foo') self.assertEqual(mylist[1].foo, 2) self.assertEqual(mylist[1].bar, 'bar')

If service_down_time is less than report_interval, services will

'}]
commit_message:
Make sure report_interval is less than service_down_time

If service_down_time is less than report_interval, services will
routinely be considered down, because they report in too rarely.
Add check for service_down_time vs report_interval, if report_interval
is larger than service_down_time, automatically change
service_down_time to be report_interval * 2.5 .

Closes bug #1261611

Change-Id: Icfa2a79d9df45a9674e8312f6ce67bc5a38275d2
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/33/62533/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Fix inconsistent usages for network resources

If a normal user created a fixed_ip/floating_ip, a usage record with
column `in_use=1` will be created in the quota_usages table, and if an
admin user deleted the resource, a new record with column `in_use=-1`
will be created..This will cause the quota for the resources not
released.

Fixes bug 1220727

Change-Id: I705f2f9ef327a3198da6a47df772c3a1a28e1b4e
(cherry picked from commit f2dfdd4ab37965a6559f3c033cdf877e0fe172be)

subject: Python 3: fix comparison between list and map
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-12-16 11:19:05.000000000', 'files': ['keystoneclient/tests/v3/test_projects.py', 'keystoneclient/tests/v2_0/test_users.py', 'keystoneclient/tests/v3/test_groups.py', 'keystoneclient/tests/utils.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/python-keystoneclient/commit/b28cbeffcdc8c56fbe4fad0645e9584e57c8fca5', 'message': 'Python 3: fix comparison between list and map

In HTTPretty, the query string is given as dictionary whose elements are maps,
which cannot becompared to a list in Python 3 without being converted to a list

Change-Id: I2827441815428148e3b0fb76de901c71c9a2f2f4
'}]
commit_message:
Python 3: fix comparison between list and map

In HTTPretty, the query string is given as dictionary whose elements are maps,
which cannot becompared to a list in Python 3 without being converted to a list
first. Do that in assertQueryStringIs(), and use assertQueryStringIs where
appropriate.

Change-Id: I2827441815428148e3b0fb76de901c71c9a2f2f4
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-keystoneclient refs/changes/33/62333/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: query_string = httpretty.last_request().querystring for k, v in query_string.items(): query_string[k] = list(v) self.assertEqual(query_string, val)
deleted_lines: self.assertEqual(httpretty.last_request().querystring, val)

commit_message:
Remove 'mount_point' from guestagent RPC API

Reason:
 - 'mount_point' is used inconsistently across guestagent code.
 - Sometimes its value is taken from parameters of RPC call
   and sometimes from CONF.
Changes:
 - Adding oslo mysql group. Now mount point retrieves
   via CONF.mysql.muont_point
 - This patch makes this value being taken from existing my.cnf.
 - 'mount_point' paramenter is removed from all trove-*.conf files.

Implements: blueprint remove-mount-point-from-parameters-for-instance-prepare
Closes-bug: 1248212

Change-Id: I2631f7b7cd0de9a13a20bd986b7f3fe8d363bf0e

commit_message:
Neutron metering agent: add CRUD tests

This patch adds simple tests for the metering labels and metering label rules
defined in Neutron.

Change-Id: I207b6173edc0cf7aa4431f8b6502cbc6d89096b9
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/19/49719/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Copyright (C) 2013 eNovance SAS <licensing@enovance.com> # # Author: Cyril Roelandt <cyril.roelandt@enovance.com> # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. from tempest.api.network import base from tempest import clients from tempest.common import isolated_creds from tempest.common.utils.data_utils import rand_name class MeteringTest(base.BaseNetworkTest): _interface = 'json' @classmethod def setUpClass(cls): super(MeteringTest, cls).setUpClass() # These tests must be run by the admin, who is the only one able to # create metering labels and rules according to the default policy. cls.adm_user = cls.config.identity.admin_username cls.adm_pass = cls.config.identity.admin_password cls.adm_tenant = cls.config.identity.admin_tenant_name if not all((cls.adm_user, cls.adm_pass, cls.adm_tenant)): msg = ("Missing Volume Admin API credentials " "in configuration.") raise cls.skipException(msg) cls.isolated_creds = isolated_creds.IsolatedCreds(cls.__name__) creds = cls.isolated_creds.get_admin_creds() admin_username, admin_tenant_name, admin_password = creds cls.os_adm = clients.Manager(username=admin_username, password=admin_password, tenant_name=admin_tenant_name, interface=cls._interface) cls.client = cls.os_adm.network_client @classmethod def tearDownClass(cls): cls.isolated_creds.clear_isolated_creds() super(MeteringTest, cls).tearDownClass() def _create_meter_label(self): name = rand_name('meter-label-') resp, create_body = self.client.create_meter_label(name) self.assertEqual(resp['status'], '201') label_id = create_body['metering_label']['id'] self.addCleanup(self._delete_meter_label, label_id) return label_id def _delete_meter_label(self, meter_label_id): resp, _ = self.client.delete_meter_label(meter_label_id) self.assertEqual(204, resp.status) resp, list_body = self.client.list_meter_labels() self.assertEqual('200', resp['status']) meter_labels_ids = \ [label['id'] for label in list_body['metering_labels']] self.assertNotIn(meter_label_id, meter_labels_ids) def _delete_meter_label_rule(self, rule_id): resp, _ = self.client.delete_meter_label_rule(rule_id) self.assertEqual(204, resp.status) resp, list_body = self.client.list_meter_label_rules() self.assertEqual('200', resp['status']) rule_ids = [rule['id'] for rule in list_body['metering_label_rules']] self.assertNotIn(rule_id, rule_ids) def test_create_meter_label(self): label_id = self._create_meter_label() resp, list_body = self.client.list_meter_labels() self.assertEqual(resp['status'], '200') metering_labels_ids = \ [label['id'] for label in list_body['metering_labels']] self.assertIn(label_id, metering_labels_ids) def test_create_meter_label_rule(self): label_id = self._create_meter_label() resp, create_body = self.client.create_meter_label_rule(label_id, '0.0.0.0/0') self.assertEqual(resp['status'], '201') rule_id = create_body['metering_label_rule']['id'] self.addCleanup(self._delete_meter_label_rule, rule_id) resp, list_body = self.client.list_meter_label_rules() self.assertEqual(resp['status'], '200') rule_ids = [rule['id'] for rule in list_body['metering_label_rules']] self.assertIn(rule_id, rule_ids)

commit_message:
Add more granular logging support

cinder::logging provides the option to log cinder messages to
/var/log/cinder or to syslog. It also provides a minimal logging
threshold.
Added logging tests and moved to cinder_logging spec

Added new parameters to cinder class log_level and log_dir.

Change-Id: Iaa090083f66ae026c1ff5a4454a70390111734ac
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bogdando@mail.ru>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-cinder refs/changes/38/59338/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # # [log_level] # Minimal logging threshold used if debug and verbose are false. # (Optional) Defaults to 'WARNING'. $log_dir = '/var/log/cinder', $log_level = 'WARNING', class { 'cinder::logging': use_syslog => $use_syslog, debug => $debug, verbose => $debug, log_facility => $log_facility, log_dir => $log_dir,
deleted_lines: if $use_syslog { cinder_config { 'DEFAULT/use_syslog': value => true; 'DEFAULT/syslog_log_facility': value => $log_facility; } } else { cinder_config { 'DEFAULT/use_syslog': value => false; }

commit_message:
Sync oslo policy

Pull policy from oslo-incubator as of 339cdff. Previous version
of the policy module was updated more than year ago and therefore
it's pretty outdated.

commit_message:
Bump webob requirements to include 1.3

Ubuntu 14.04 is shipping WebOb 1.3, which
passes test without a problem. Bump requirements
to include webob 1.3.

Change-Id: I2623b9397df417bc8b49cf77bc6d25427d2480f5
Signed-off-by: Chuck Short <chuck.short@canonical.com>

commit_message:
Fix fwaas and lbaas UI for NVP advanced service router

NVP advanced service plugin provides firewall and load balancer service on
an L3 router. The UI need to be enhanced to support extension attributes
for firewall, load balancer and advanced service router.

The following attributes are added to UI:
    Router: distributed and service_router
    Firewall: router_id
    Vip: router_id

Tests:
    - Deploy openstack using openvswitch as plugin, and use default
loadbalancer and firewall plugin. Verified Vip and Firewall can be created
via Horizon UI.
    - Deploy openstack using nvp advanced service router. Verified Vip and
Firewall can be created via Horizon UI on selected router.

Closes-Bug: #1231248
Change-Id: Id8155c3070af55381bf2dd89875852717002a553

commit_message:
Implement as_yaml_str hot intrinisic function

This would be useful to represent cloud-config using template
syntax structures rather than a string block.

For completeness, HOT probably needs an as_json_str function too.

partial blueprint cloud-init-resource

Change-Id: Id5f5cdf99a7f8fc38af0a66216ae6bced8cc7145
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/55/59555/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import yaml def test_as_yaml_str(self): snippet = {'a': ['one', 'two', 'three'], 'b': None, 'c': 'c'} tmpl = parser.Template(hot_tpl_empty) self.assertEqual( tmpl.resolve_as_yaml_str({'as_yaml_str': snippet}), yaml.dump(snippet, Dumper=template_format.yaml_dumper)) self.assertEqual( tmpl.resolve_as_yaml_str({'as_yaml_str': None}), yaml.dump(None, Dumper=template_format.yaml_dumper)) self.assertEqual( tmpl.resolve_as_yaml_str({'as_yaml_str': []}), yaml.dump([], Dumper=template_format.yaml_dumper)) self.assertEqual( tmpl.resolve_as_yaml_str({'as_yaml_str': 'foo'}), yaml.dump('foo', Dumper=template_format.yaml_dumper))

commit_message:
[PROOF OF CONCEPT] Integration testing

We are glad to introduce our concept of ironic's integration testing
implementation.

In short the actual scheme is very closer to the tripleo-ci, but might be
suitable only for ironic testing without all the unnecessary things.

All additional details would be disscussed on #openstack-ironic irc channel

Thanks for your time

Change-Id: I0d7759a0b599e7791f964ca18955cc4e503722ac

commit_message:
Do not pass bytes to json.loads()

In assertRequestBodyIs, we could end up passing bytes to json.loads(), thus
triggering a TypeError. We make sure to decode the value first if needed.

Change-Id: I720f895215ee2c230edc27c98e778536e0cbb2fa
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-keystoneclient refs/changes/62/62362/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import six val = httpretty.last_request().body if isinstance(val, six.binary_type): val = val.decode() val = jsonutils.loads(val)
deleted_lines: val = jsonutils.loads(httpretty.last_request().body)

commit_message:
Stop running TempestConfig() on import

This commit removes all the calls to TempestConfig() during import.
Doing this was causing errors when we ran pep8 and other jobs that
imports tempest files but did not have a config file when the job
was run. For uses of config in skip decorators they are replaced
with a new method in the base test class skip_config() which is
used to raise a skip exception based on the config file.

This also moves the cli config group to tempest.config. Previously,
the cli tests used the traditional oslo.config global CONF object.
However, this could cause issues if the test order changed and/or if
there wasn't a strict dependency on the cli __init__.py file, but the
cli group was used in another file.

Change-Id: I049c0d22d70e3b8142d00373ea41d89e7731290c

commit_message:
Fix callstack clearing

The ShellFixture callstack clearing code was not being run - the
Fixture interface doesn't define tearDown.

Change-Id: I7d7fbdf4f47ec5761b916e82d41053b5e240b30a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-novaclient refs/changes/85/61885/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: self.addCleanup(self._clear_callstack) def _clear_callstack(self):
deleted_lines: def tearDown(self): super(ShellFixture, self).tearDown()

commit_message:
Fix for qemu-nbd hang (Take #2)

Additional check to see if the NBD device is still in the partition
list before we try to allocate it.

Change-Id: I4408783e03ec3653fe76683d744186610c2b32ee
Closes-Bug: #973413
Partial-Bug: #1254890
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/60/63960/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: NBD_MAJOR = '43' def _is_nbd_used(self, device): LOG.debug('Looking for NBD device : %s' % device) partitions = open("/proc/partitions", "r").read() for rows in partitions.split('\n'): columns = rows.split() if len(columns) > 3 and columns[1] == NBD_MAJOR: busy_device = columns[3].strip() if busy_device == device: LOG.debug('NBD device was active : %s' % device) return True LOG.debug('NBD device was not active : %s' % device) return False if (not os.path.exists(os.path.join('/sys/block/', device, 'pid')) and not self._is_nbd_used(device)):

commit_message:
Attach volume eventhough the instance is shutoff

It should be possible to attach a volume to a shutoff instance.
Nova CLI (nova volume-attach) allows this and Horizon should be
on par.

Change-Id: Ie7c351e5b23f218d6d10c80b9aebbf233c62b7be
Closes-Bug: 1251255

commit_message:
Fix incorrect exception on os-migrateLive

If the server state is conflict to live-migrate, it raises
400(HTTPBadRequest)exception.We should raise HTTPConflict instead of
HTTPBadRequest.

Change-Id: I40ccb0f268716da20ae4b3de9d295a41a2dba18d
Closes-Bug: #1255001

commit_message:
Fix "device" as the optional para on volume-attach

Attach a volume to a server without device name, the client returned the
error msg: "error: too few arguments". But for server, we can attach a
volume to a server without the device name.

Change-Id: Ia2743c6e3956cae6591ecd414baf89b0dbcf532b
Closes-Bug: #1257137
